intro: Schradera cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' schradera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant is evergreen, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky hair. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
